A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie had the potential to be one of the best movies in the series. Episode 7 had so much unanswered questions and interesting characters with (potential) mysterious back stories that could have been reveiled in episode 8 with an interesting story. i.e.:

Snoke's history\, Luke training Rey\, Phasma's character development\, Rey's prarents reveal\, Fin and Po's integration and impact on the plot/storey...

They could have used all of the above to formulate a epic movie\, but instead decided to discard the above factors and rather do a Pirates of the Caribbean type movies where I felt exhausted half way into the movie due to horrible pacing\, stupid plot holes and dumb character decisions.

I love the origional trilogy and even defend the prequal trilogy because I think they are nder rated\, but this movie...sigh...this is the first time I felt empty after watching Star Wars movie\, where I walked out of the cinema feeling empty thinking: I dont care what happens next in SW\, in fact\, I think It is best that it rather just ended happily in Endor
